title: New York Lawmakers Consider Reclassifying Gig Workers
text:
New York state lawmakers should help “gig economy” workers by developing nontraditional ways for them to get benefits rather than reclassifying them as traditional employees, business and technology groups said Wednesday.

The arguments unfolded at a state Senate hearing about the classification of people who find work as independent contractors through apps. Labor unions in the state have been pushing for a law, similar to a measure approved earlier this year in California, that would legally reclassify many app-based workers—including...
description: New York state lawmakers should help “gig economy” workers by developing nontraditional ways for them to get benefits, business and technology groups said Wednesday.
